cyclone.name: HARVEY
cyclone.current_location: about 250 miles SE of Corpus Christi, Texas
cyclone.trajectory: moving northwest toward the middle Texas coast, then forecast to slow or stall near/just inland of the coast before drifting slowly north-eastward early next week
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: middle Texas coast between Corpus Christi and Port O'Connor

port.name: Port of Greater Baton Rouge, LA

weather_observation.watch_coast: N/A – no watches posted for Louisiana coast at this time
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning Port Mansfield TX to Sargent TX; Tropical-Storm Warning north of Sargent to High Island TX
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Texas coastline and portions of southwest and south-central Louisiana
weather_observation.wind: Low to moderate chance (up to 21%) of experiencing tropical-storm-force winds late in the 5-day period, with peak gusts 35-45 mph possible.
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected at the port’s inland location along the Mississippi River.
weather_observation.rainfall: Potential for 7–15 inches of rain through mid-week, creating a high risk of urban and river flooding around Baton Rouge.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Prolonged river flooding and possible tornado threat from outer rain bands.
